what: CentroidR provides the infrastructure to centroid profile spectra
title: CentroidR provides the infrastructure to centroid profile spectra
text: Repository centroid profile spectra. repository experimental. Use risks. Inspired original work https://github.com/EuracBiomedicalResearch/batch_centroid

title: CentroidR provides the infrastructure to centroid profile spectra
text: minimally need: mzML file containing profile spectra generic command case: Note: using Sciex raw format, use .wiff .wiff2 step!

title: CentroidR provides the infrastructure to centroid profile spectra
CentroidR provides the infrastructure to centroid profile spectra
code: "path_to_your/profiles/" |>     list.files(pattern = ".mzML", full.names = TRUE) |>     purrr::walk(       .f = CentroidR::centroid_one_file,       pattern = "/profiles/",       replacement = "/profiles_centroided/",       .progress = TRUE) Rscript inst/scripts/centroiding.R --directory "path_to_your/profiles/" --pattern "/profiles/" --replacement "/profiles_centroided/" Rscript inst/scripts/centroiding.R --help

title: CentroidR provides the infrastructure to centroid profile spectra
text: see parameters
code: docker pull adafede/centroidr # docker build . -t adafede/centroidr docker run --rm \   -v path_to_your:/home \   adafede/centroidr \   Rscript centroiding.R --file "home/profile/spectra.mzML" --pattern "/profile/" --replacement "/profile_centroided/" docker run --rm \   -v path_to_your:/home \   adafede/centroidr \   Rscript centroiding.R --directory "home/profiles/" --pattern "/profiles/" --replacement "/profiles_centroided/" docker run --rm \    -v path_to_your:/home \   adafede/centroidr \   Rscript centroiding.R --help

what: Centroid an mzML file with configurable parameters — centroid_one_file
title: Centroid an mzML file with configurable parameters — centroid_one_file
text: function processes mzML file apply centroiding detailed controls peak picking, smoothing, noise estimation. allows fine-tuning MS1 MS2 peak detection, optimizing spectral data analysis various experimental needs.

title: Centroid an mzML file with configurable parameters — centroid_one_file
code: centroid_one_file(   file,   pattern,   replacement,   min_datapoints_ms1 = 5L,   min_datapoints_ms2 = 2L,   mz_tol_da_ms1 = 0.0025,   mz_tol_da_ms2 = 0.0025,   mz_tol_ppm_ms1 = 5,   mz_tol_ppm_ms2 = 5,   mz_fun_ms1 = base::mean,   mz_fun_ms2 = base::mean,   int_fun_ms1 = base::max,   int_fun_ms2 = base::max,   mz_weighted = TRUE,   time_domain = TRUE,   intensity_exponent = 3 )

title: Centroid an mzML file with configurable parameters — centroid_one_file
text: file character(1) Path input mzML file. Must valid, accessible mzML format file. pattern character(1) Regular expression pattern match input file path, used modifying output file path. replacement character(1) Replacement string altering output file path based pattern. min_datapoints_ms1 integer(1) (default: 5L) Minimum datapoints considered MS1 data. min_datapoints_ms2 integer(1) (default: 2L) Minimum datapoints considered MS2 data. mz_tol_da_ms1 numeric(1) (default: 0.0025) m/z tolerance Daltons MS1 data. mz_tol_da_ms2 numeric(1) (default: 0.0025) m/z tolerance Daltons MS2 data. mz_tol_ppm_ms1 numeric(1) (default: 5) m/z tolerance parts per million (ppm) MS1. mz_tol_ppm_ms2 numeric(1) (default: 5) m/z tolerance parts per million (ppm) MS2. mz_fun_ms1 function (default: base::mean) Function aggregate m/z values within peak group (MS1). Ignored mz_weighted = TRUE. mz_fun_ms2 function (default: base::mean) Function aggregate m/z values within peak group (MS2). Ignored mz_weighted = TRUE. int_fun_ms1 function (default: base::max) Function aggregate peak intensities within peak group (MS1). int_fun_ms2 function (default: base::max) Function aggregate peak intensities within peak group (MS2). mz_weighted logical(1) (default: TRUE) TRUE, uses intensity-weighted mean m/z value aggregation. time_domain logical(1) (default: TRUE) TRUE, uses square root m/z weighting (TRUE TOF). intensity_exponent numeric(1) (default: 3) mz_weighted=TRUE, exponent intensity m/z weighting.

title: Centroid an mzML file with configurable parameters — centroid_one_file
text: logical(1) Returns TRUE centroiding successful, otherwise FALSE.

title: Centroid an mzML file with configurable parameters — centroid_one_file
text: function processes MS1 MS2 data user-defined smoothing, peak-picking, noise estimation. File path modifications supported via pattern replacement.

title: Centroid an mzML file with configurable parameters — centroid_one_file
text: Johannes Rainer, Adriano Rutz

Wrapper for centroiding with error handling — try_centroid_one_file
text: file Path input mzML file. pattern Pattern modifying file path. replacement Replacement string output path. ... Additional parameters pass centroid_one_file.
